availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Catharine Troutman Temple on March 29, 1825. Married to Susan Temple. Father of Cosby Temple, James Temple, Sarah Temple, David Temple, Robert Temple, Joseph Temple, Mary Temple, William Temple, Noah Temple, and Taylor Temple. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850 and 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 302; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 269; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 27; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Pellville, p. 2; Jordan Dodd, Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Ancestry, Bullitt County, Kentucky, March 29, 1825.
